{{other people|Khalid Mahmood}} {{Use British English|date=June 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Infobox MP | image = Official portrait of Mr Khalid Mahmood crop 2.jpg | honorific-prefix = | name = Khalid Mahmood | honorific-suffix = {{Post-nominals|country=GBR|size=100%|MP}} |office = [[Minister of State for Europe|Shadow Minister of State for Europe]] |leader = [[Jeremy Corbyn]] |1blankname = Shadowing |1namedata = [[Alan Duncan|Sir Alan Duncan]] |term_start = 6 October 2016 |term_end = |predecessor = [[Fabian Hamilton]] |successor = | office1 = [[Member of Parliament (UK)|Member of Parliament]]
for [[Birmingham Perry Barr (UK Parliament constituency)|Birmingham Perry Barr]] | parliament1 = | majority1 = 18,383 (41.6%) | predecessor1 = [[Jeff Rooker]] | successor1 = | term_start1 = 7 June 2001 | term_end1 = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|07|13|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Azad Kashmir]], Pakistan | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = British | spouse = | party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = [[UCE Birmingham]] | occupation = | profession = | signature = | website = | footnotes = |religion = [[Islam]] }} '''Khalid Mahmood''' (born 13 July 1961) is a British [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] [[politician]] who has been the Member of Parliament (MP) for [[Birmingham Perry Barr (UK Parliament constituency)|Birmingham Perry Barr]] since [[United Kingdom general election, 2001|2001]]. ==Political career== Mahmood is a graduate of [[UCE Birmingham]] and a former engineer with a trade union background. He was a [[Birmingham City Council]]lor from 1990 to 1992. In 2001, Mahmood was selected for the [[Birmingham Perry Barr (UK Parliament constituency)|Perry Barr seat]] by local Labour party members. Although Mahmood held the seat for Labour in the [[United Kingdom general election, 2001|2001 election]], his share of the vote fell by 16.5%,{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/hi/english/static/vote2001/results_constituencies/constituencies/059.stm |title=Birmingham Perry Barr 2001 Election Results |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=3 April 2010}} much of which went to the [[Liberal Democrats (UK)|Liberal Democrat]] candidate Jon Hunt, who ran on an anti-sleaze ticket. Mahmood subsequently increased his share of the vote slightly at the [[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005 election]], though his majority fell by 805 votes. He was again elected in 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.birmingham.gov.uk/general-election-2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100508033256/http://www.birmingham.gov.uk/general-election-2010 |archive-date= 8 May 2010 |dead-url=yes |title=General Election 2010 – Birmingham City Council |accessdate=8 December 2015 |df= }} He served as [[Parliamentary Private Secretary]] to Home Office Minister [[Tony McNulty]] from 10 November 2005 until 6 September 2006, when he resigned after signing a letter calling for Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]] to step down.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/5319328.stm |title=Blair hit by wave of resignations |date=6 September 2006 |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=3 April 2010}} Pakistani-born Mahmood stated that he was "flabbergasted and shocked" after it was discovered that [[Osama bin Laden]] was living in a city with thousands of Pakistani troops, reviving questions about alleged links between [[al-Qaeda]] and elements in Pakistan's security forces.{{cite news |last=Woodcock |first=Andrew |date=2 May 2011 |title=MP 'shocked' at bin Laden Pakistan discovery |work=The Independent |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/mp-shocked-at-bin-laden-pakistan-discovery-2277941.htm |accessdate=2 May 2011}} Mahmood opposed the decision by Birmingham College in 2013 to ban students wearing veils. "I am seriously concerned that the college has taken this approach," Mahmood told ''[[The Huffington Post]]''. "I see no reason why young women should not be able to practice their faith and wear what is appropriate for their religion, [...] It is about freedom to protect your rights. The college should demonstrate and encourage respect of belief, colour and background. [The decision] is not an example to set to students."{{cite web |last=Sherriff|first=Lucy|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2013/09/10/birmingham-metropolitan-college-bans-muslim-students-wearing-veils_n_3898013.html|title=Muslim Students Banned From Wearing Veils, Niqabs, For 'Safety' At Birmingham Metropolitan College|work=The Huffington Post|date=10 September 2013|accessdate=5 March 2015}} In House of Commons divisions, he has voted for the introduction of national ID cards, student top-up fees, anti-terrorism laws and he voted against investigating the [[Iraq War]].{{cite web |url=https://www.theyworkforyou.com/mp/khalid_mahmood/birmingham%2C_perry_barr |title=Khalid Mahmood |publisher=theyworkforyou.com |accessdate=3 April 2010}} He is also on the Advisory Council (as a Labour Political Council member) of the [[Henry Jackson Society]].{{cite web|url=http://henryjacksonsociety.org/people/council-members/ |title=Khalid Mahmood on Advisory Council of Henry Jackson Society |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130923022301/http://henryjacksonsociety.org/people/council-members/ |archivedate=23 September 2013 |df= }} In the [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum|EU referendum]], Mahmood initially supported the Leave campaign but left in February when it started to attack migrants. In June, he subsequently announced his support for the Remain campaign.{{cite news|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/birmingham-mp-khalid-mahmood-backs-11451505|title=Birmingham MP Khalid Mahmood backs EU 'remain' campaign |date=9 June 2016|accessdate=10 June 2016|newspaper=Birmingham Mail}} ===UK MP expenses row=== In May 2009, it was revealed, as part of [[United Kingdom parliamentary expenses scandal|a series of leaked UK MPs expense details]], that Mahmood claimed for £1,350 to stay in a five-star west London hotel with his girlfriend.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/politics/8064731.stm |title=Man behind expenses leak revealed |date=23 May 2009 |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=3 April 2010 }} Mahmood also claimed more than £35,000 in expenses for food over the course of his eight years as an MP.{{cite news |url=http://www.sundaymercury.net/news/midlands-news/2009/05/24/expenses-lovenest-of-birmingham-mp-khalid-mahmood-66331-23698297/ |title=Expenses lovenest of Birmingham MP Khalid Mahmood |date=24 May 2009 |first=Jeanette |last=Oldham |newspaper=Sunday Mercury |accessdate=3 April 2010 }} ==Awards and nominations== In January 2015, Mahmood was nominated for the Politician of the Year award at the [[British Muslim Awards]].{{cite news |last= |first= |url=http://www.asianimage.co.uk/news/business/11745550.British_Muslim_Awards_2015_finalists_unveiled/|title=British Muslim Awards 2015 finalists unveiled|work= |location= |publisher=''Asian Image''|date=23 January 2015|accessdate=1 November 2015}} == Personal life == In January 2014, Mahmood underwent a [[kidney transplant]] at the [[Queen Elizabeth Hospital Birmingham|Queen Elizabeth Hospital]] in [[Edgbaston]], Birmingham, receiving an organ from an unnamed live donor.{{cite news|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/birmingham-mp-khalid-mahmood-recovering-6539413|title=Birmingham MP Khalid Mahmood recovering after kidney transplant|last=Elkes|first=Neil|date=21 January 2014|work=[[Birmingham Mail]]|accessdate=10 December 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-birmingham-26385892|title=Transplant MP Khalid Mahmood to return to Commons|date=28 February 2014|work=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=10 December 2015}} He had previously been on [[dialysis]], following [[kidney failure]] in 2008. His twin brother died from kidney failure. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{Official website}} *{{UK MP links |parliament=mr-khalid-mahmood/1392 |hansardcurr=1647 |hansard=mr-khalid-mahmood |publicwhip=Khalid_Mahmood |theywork=khalid_mahmood}} *[http://politics.guardian.co.uk/person/0,9290,-7228,00.html Guardian Unlimited Politics – Ask Aristotle: Khalid Mahmood MP] * {{C-SPAN|khalidmahmood}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|uk}} {{s-bef|before=[[Jeff Rooker]]}} {{s-ttl|title=Member of Parliament

[[File:Maria Silbert.png|thumb|Maria Silbert]] '''Frau Maria Silbert''' (1866-1936) was an Austrian spiritualist [[mediumship|medium]].
==Biography==
Silbert was born in [[Waltendorf]], [[Graz]] and claimed powers of [[apport (paranormal)|apportation]] and [[psychokinesis]] as well as the ability to produce "spirit raps". Her famous trick was to engrave [[cigarette case]]s under the table during her [[séance]]s.<ref name="Polidoro 2001"> [[Massimo Polidoro]]. (2001). ''Final Seance: The Strange Friendship Between Houdini and Conan Doyle''. Prometheus Books. p. 103. {{ISBN|978-1573928960}}</ref> She allowed some lighting in her séances but did not allow investigators to look under the table where most of her phenomena was said to occur.<ref name="Roberts 1932">[[C. E. Bechhofer Roberts]]. (1932). ''The Truth about Spiritualism''. Kessinger Publishing. pp. 130-132. {{ISBN|978-1417981281}} </ref>
In 1925, the British psychical researcher [[Harry Price]] investigated Silbet and caught her using her feet and toes to move objects in the séance room.<ref>[[Lewis Spence]]. (1991). ''Encyclopedia of Occultism & Parapsychology''. Gale Research Company. p. 1522. {{ISBN|978-0810301962}}</ref>
[[Walter Franklin Prince]] in 1927 discovered how Silbert performed the cigarette trick. She had developed the ability to maneuver a stiletto using only her feet and was thus able to write names on the cigarette cases when they were held under the table.<ref name="Polidoro 2001"/> Another researcher [[Theodore Besterman]] investigated Silbert in 1928 and observed that the "spirit raps" only occurred when Silbert had her legs under the table or in front of the chair which suggested that she tapped the furniture herself with her feet to make the sounds.<ref name="Roberts 1932"/>
Adalbert Evian supported Silbert and wrote the book ''The Mediumship of Maria Silbert'' (1936). The psychical researcher [[Eric Dingwall]] in a review wrote "As a work of scientific interest it is worthless, but as illustrating the minds of those over whom Frau Silbert cast her influence it is by no means without value."<ref>[[Trevor H. Hall]]. (1984). ''The Enigma of Daniel Home: Medium Or Fraud?''. Prometheus Books. p. 44. {{ISBN|978-0879752361}}</ref>

Bush]] |term_start3 = May 1, 2003 |term_end3 = May 4, 2007 |predecessor3 = [[Charles O. Bush]] |term_start4 = August 1, 2002 |term_end4 = May 1, 2003 |predecessor4 = [[Sally Katzen]] |successor4 = [[Clay Johnson III|Clay Johnson]] |birth_name = Mark Whitty Everson |birth_date = {{nowrap|{{birth date and age|1954|9|10}}}} |birth_place = [[Manhattan|New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], [[United States|U.S.]] |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |spouse = Nanette Rutka {{small|(1984–2008)}} |children = 4 |alma_mater = [[Yale College|Yale University]]
[[New York University Stern School of Business|New York University]] |signature = Mark Everson signature.png }} '''Mark Whitty Everson''' (born September 10, 1954) is an [[United States|American]] politician who is currently the Vice Chairman of [[alliantgroup]] and served as the 46th [[Commissioner of Internal Revenue]] from 2003 until 2007. Prior to his appointment as Commissioner of the [[Internal Revenue Service|IRS]], Everson held a number of federal government positions in the administrations of [[George W. Bush]] and [[Ronald Reagan]], as well as at the state level within the administration of Indiana Governor [[Mitch Daniels]]. In August 2009, Everson joined [[alliantgroup]], LP, a national tax advisory consultant, to advise the firm and its clients on matters related to the IRS and on strategic, operational, and client service initiatives.{{cite web|url=http://www.alliantgroup.com/_ag/index.cfm/newsroom/press-releases/irs-commissioner-joins-alliantgroup/ |title=IRS Commissioner Joins alliantgroup |publisher=Alliantgroup.com |date=2009-08-04 |accessdate=2015-04-11}} Everson was a candidate for the [[Republican Party presidential primaries, 2016|Republican presidential nomination in 2016]], until he withdrew his candidacy on November 5, 2015. ==Education== Everson received his [[Bachelor of Arts]] degree in [[history]] from [[Yale University]] and [[Master of Science]] degree in [[accounting]] from [[New York University]]'s [[Stern School of Business]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.aya.yale.edu/content/previous-fellowes|title=Previous Fellowes {{!}} Association of Yale Alumni|website=www.aya.yale.edu|language=en|access-date=2017-11-16}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.treasury.gov/press-center/press-releases/Pages/kd3759.aspx|title=White House Announces Mark W. Everson Tapped to Serve as New IRS Commissioner|website=www.treasury.gov|language=en-us|access-date=2017-11-16}} ==Public service and business experience== Everson served in the [[Reagan administration]] from 1982 until 1988 holding several positions at the [[United States Information Agency]] and the [[United States Department of Justice|Department of Justice]], where he was deputy commissioner of the [[Immigration and Naturalization Service]]. While at INS, he oversaw implementation of the [[Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986]], landmark legislation providing for sanctions against employers hiring [[undocumented immigrants]] and granting amnesty to qualifying undocumented immigrants. Prior to joining the Bush administration in August 2001, he was group vice president of finance at [[SC International Services]], Inc., at the time a $2 billion privately owned, [[Dallas]]-based, [[food service]]s company with leading market positions in both [[airline catering]] and home meals. From 1988 until 1998, he was an executive with the [[Pechiney Group]], one of [[France]]'s largest industrial groups. While with Pechiney, he held various financial and operating positions in the United States, France and [[Turkey]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2017}} From August 1, 2002 until his IRS confirmation, Everson served as deputy director for management for the [[Office of Management and Budget]] (OMB). He chaired the President's Management Council, which is composed of [[Cabinet (government)|cabinet]] department and major agency chief operating officers. The council is charged with improving overall [[executive branch]] management, including implementation of the President's Management Agenda. Before becoming deputy director for management, he served as controller of the [[Office of Federal Financial Management]], also a part of OMB. Everson was appointed by President [[George W. Bush]] to a five-year term as [[Commissioner of Internal Revenue]], the head of the [[Internal Revenue Service]] (IRS), and was confirmed by the [[U.S. Senate]] on May 1, 2003 as its 46th commissioner. Areas of focus during his tenure with the IRS included combating abusive tax shelters and the development of more productive enforcement relationships with counterpart tax authorities in other countries.{{cite web|url=https://www.irs.gov/uac/KPMG-to-Pay-$456-Million-for-Criminal-Violations|title=KPMG to Pay $456 Million for Criminal Violations|date=|publisher=Irs.gov|accessdate=2015-04-11}} Everson left the IRS effective May 4, 2007, before the end of his term to join the American Red Cross as its new CEO.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenonprofittimes.com/news-articles/red-cross-appoints-new-ceo/|title=Red Cross appoints new CEO - The NonProfit Times|work=The NonProfit Times|access-date=2017-11-16|language=en-US}} Later, Everson was a cabinet member for Indiana Governor [[Mitch Daniels]]{{Cite news|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/elections/presidential/candidates/2015/08/04/mark-everson-iowa-caucus-candidate-profile/31108759/|title=Mark Everson|work=Des Moines Register|access-date=2017-11-16|language=en}} from January 2009 to May 2012, where he served initially as Department of Administration Commissioner. From 2010–2012, Everson served as the Commissioner of the Department of Workforce Development, where he oversaw the state's unemployment system and federal training programs. In this role, Everson began a program that was endorsed by the Indiana Chamber of Commerce and the Indiana Manufacturers Association that helped qualifying ex-offenders realize employment opportunities.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibj.com/state-launches-program-to-help-employ-exoffenders/PARAMS/article/29096 |title=State launches program to help employ ex-offenders |publisher=Ibj.com |date=2011-08-24 |accessdate=2015-04-11}} ===American Red Cross=== On April 18, 2007, the Board of Governors of the [[American Red Cross]] unanimously approved Everson as President and Chief Executive Officer of the American Red Cross, effective May 29, 2007.{{cite news|last=Donmoyer |first=Ryan J. |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601103&sid=aLlJ6K1412mQ&refer=us |title=IRS Commissioner Mark Everson to Head American Red Cross |publisher=Bloomberg.com |date=2007-04-18 |accessdate=2015-04-11}} On November 27, 2007, the Board of Governors, after learning that Everson engaged in a personal relationship with a subordinate employee, asked for and received Everson's resignation.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/11/27/us/27cnd-cross.html |title=Red Cross Dismisses President, Citing Relationship|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=November 27, 2007|accessdate=2015-04-11|first=Stephanie|last=Strom}} The ''[[New York Post]]'' reported that the "personal relationship" was with a married woman, Paige Roberts, CEO of the Southeast Mississippi Red Cross chapter.{{cite news|last=Fenner |first=Austin |url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/12032007/news/nationalnews/red_cross_mama_850510.htm?page=0 |title=RED CROSS MAMA | New York Post |publisher=Nypost.com |date=2007-12-03 |accessdate=2015-04-11}} ==2016 presidential campaign== [[File:Mark Everson 2016.jpg|thumb|Mark Everson's campaign logo]] On March 5, 2015, Everson announced his intention to seek the [[Republican Party presidential primaries, 2016|Republican Party's]] nomination for President of the United States in the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 Presidential election]].{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/mar/5/mark-everson-launches-gop-white-house-bid-pro-amne/ |title=Mark Everson, former Reagan & Bush aide, launches GOP White House bid on pro-amnesty platform |publisher=Washingtontimes.com |date= |accessdate=2015-04-11}} He launched his bid with a video and 16-page [[open letter]], in which he laid out six primary issues: {{quote| # Fundamental tax reform. # Confronting the lawlessness of the Big Banks. # Re-establishing the draft in order to have a shared sense of national service. # Real, balanced reforms to America's entitlement programs. # Reinforcing the American tradition of assimilation through comprehensive immigration reform. # Serving only a single term to keep re-election politics out of Presidential decision-making.}} On September 11, 2015, the ''Des Moines Register'' published an op-ed entitled "Iowans should learn Everson's name, ideas", praising him as a candidate "insider enough to understand the messy business of political compromise, and outsider enough, in his words, not to 'owe any backers.'" {{cite web|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/opinion/editorials/caucus/2015/09/10/editorial-iowans-should-learn-eversons-name-ideas/72001412|title=Editorial: Iowans should learn Everson's name, ideas|website=The Des Moines Register|accessdate=11 September 2015}} Although Everson was the first declared candidate to open an office in Iowa, and logged more visits to the state than seven other major candidates, he was not listed in the Iowa Poll sponsored by Register and Bloomberg Politics.{{cite web|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/opinion/editorials/caucus/2015/09/10/editorial-iowans-should-learn-eversons-name-ideas/72001412|title=Editorial: Iowans should learn Everson's name, ideas|website=The Des Moines Register|accessdate=11 September 2015}} However, Everson was one of the 18 candidates listed on the Republican National Committee's straw poll (and even outperformed some of the GOP's front-runners in non-scientific straw polls), but was not invited to the televised debates.{{cite web|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/opinion/editorials/caucus/2015/09/10/editorial-iowans-should-learn-eversons-name-ideas/72001412|title=Editorial: Iowans should learn Everson's name, ideas|website=The Des Moines Register|accessdate=11 September 2015}}{{cite web|title=Missing in Cleveland: GOP candidate Mark Everson|last1=Harper|first1=John|url=http://www.cleveland.com/open/index.ssf/2015/08/missing_in_cleveland_gop_candi.html|website=Cleveland.com|accessdate=6 August 2015}} After being informed that he would not be allowed to participate in a scheduled Fox News debate in Cleveland on August 6, 2015, Everson filed a formal complaint with the Federal Election Commission, arguing that Fox News had violated election laws by failing to adhere to consistent criteria in determining the candidates that would make the debate stage.{{cite web|title=Missing in Cleveland: GOP candidate Mark Everson|last1=Harper|first1=John|url=http://www.cleveland.com/open/index.ssf/2015/08/missing_in_cleveland_gop_candi.html|website=Cleveland.com|accessdate=6 August 2015}} Fox News originally stated that candidates must be polling at 1 percent in an average of five national polls to participate, but did away with the standard a week before the scheduled debate.{{cite web|title=Missing in Cleveland: GOP candidate Mark Everson|last1=Harper|first1=John|url=http://www.cleveland.com/open/index.ssf/2015/08/missing_in_cleveland_gop_candi.html|website=Cleveland.com|accessdate=6 August 2015}} On August 7, 2015, the ''Cleveland Plain Dealer'' ran an op-ed arguing that Everson should have been included in the 5 p.m. debate.{{cite web|title=Cheers & Jeers, with a Jeer to those who let maggot-ridden, starved Akron dog die: editorial|url=http://www.cleveland.com/opinion/index.ssf/2015/08/cheers_jeers_including_a_cheer_1.html|website=Cleveland.com|accessdate=7 August 2015}} While on the campaign trail, Everson was one of the earliest critics of eventual Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump. After Trump's presidential announcement, Everson called for Trump to drop out of the race due to his false and incendiary comments regarding Mexican immigrants.{{cite web|last1=Derby|first1=Kevin|title=Donald Trump Compared to Dylann Roof by GOP Dark Horse Mark Everson|url=http://www.sunshinestatenews.com/blog/donald-trump-compared-dylann-roof-gop-dark-horse-mark-everson|website=Sunshine State News|accessdate=24 June 2015}}{{cite web|last1=Everson|first1=Mark W.|title=Why I cannot support Trump|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/opinion/columnists/2016/06/28/why-cannot-support-trump/86453032/|website=The Des Moines Register|accessdate=28 June 2016}} Everson put almost $400,000 of his own money into the campaign and raised around $100,000. On November 5, 2015, Everson withdrew from the race citing lack of funds, no debate inclusion, and scarce media attention as factors for ending his campaign.{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/the-fix/wp/2015/11/05/the-republican-fields-16th-candidate-is-ending-his-longest-shot-campaign/|title=The Republican field's 16th candidate is ending his longest-shot campaign|work=Washington Post|author=Phillip Bump|date=2015-11-05|accessdate=2015-11-21}} In June 2016, before the Republican convention, Everson stated that he could neither "get on board" with Trump nor "look the other way." He condemned the candidate's policy proposals as "reckless, be they stripping trillions in revenues from the Treasury…or countenancing nuclear proliferation to name two of the worst." Everson wrote that "the deplorable demeanor he has deliberately cultivated over decades" disqualifies Trump from public service and that "his campaign is more than divisive; particularly for our young it is destructive and even frightening." {{cite web|last1=Everson|first1=Mark W.|title=Why I cannot support Trump|url=http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/opinion/columnists/2016/06/28/why-cannot-support-trump/86453032/|website=The Des Moines Register|accessdate=28 June 2016}} ==Further reading== * Crenshaw, Albert B. "IRS to Tell Taxpayers Of Frozen Refunds", Washingtonpost.com. Page D01. January 25, 2006. * Block, Sandra. "IRS Quietly Freezes Many Refunds", USA Today. January 10, 2006.{{cite news|last=Block |first=Sandra |url=https://www.usatoday.com/money/perfi/taxes/2006-01-10-irs-freezing-refunds_x.htm |title=IRS quietly freezes many refunds |publisher=Usatoday.com |date=2006-01-10 |accessdate=2015-04-11}} * "Everson: IRS Will Review Frozen Refund Program"[http://www.ombwatch.org/article/blogs/entry/1461/3 ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928020844/http://www.ombwatch.org/article/blogs/entry/1461/3 |date=September 28, 2007 }} * "I.R.S. Going Slow Before Election"{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/27/washington/27taxes.html|title=I.R.S. Going Slow Before Election|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2015-04-11|date=2006-10-27}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ''This article incorporates information from the [[United States Internal Revenue Service]]. As a work of the [[U.S. federal government]], it is in the [[public domain]].'' ==External links== {{wikinews|Wikinews interviews Mark Everson, U.S. Republican Party presidential candidate}} * {{C-SPAN|markeverson}} * [http://www.redcross.org Red Cross Official website] * [http://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm/bay/content.view/cpid/624.htm Interview with new American Red Cross CEO Mark Everson] * [http://www.markforamerica.com Everson's Presidential Campaign Website] {{United States presidential election, 2016}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Everson, Mark}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:American Red Cross personnel]] [[Category:Commissioners of Internal Revenue]] [[Category:George W. Bush administration personnel]] [[Category:Indiana Republicans]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:New York (state) Republicans]] [[Category:People from Manhattan]] [[Category:Reagan administration personnel]] [[Category:Stern School of Business alumni]] [[Category:United States Department of Justice officials]] [[Category:United States Office of Management and Budget officials]] [[Category:United States presidential candidates, 2016]] [[Category:21st-century American politicians]] [[Category:Yale University alumni]]

[[Central School of Speech and Drama]] }} '''Morgane Polański''' (born 20 January 1993) is a French actress and model, best known for portraying [[Gisela of France|Princess Gisla]] in the [[History Channel]] series ''[[Vikings (2013 TV series)|Vikings]]''. == Early life and education == Polanski is the daughter of French-Polish filmmaker [[Roman Polanski]] and French actress [[Emmanuelle Seigner]]. She has a younger brother, Elvis. Polanski was raised [[bilingual]]ly in [[French language|French]] and [[Polish language|Polish]].{{cite news|url=http://www.tvn24.pl/kultura-styl,8/piekna-francuzka-czuje-sie-polka,132782.html |title=Piękna Francuzka czuje się Polką |date=2 May 2010 |accessdate=7 June 2016 |language=Polish |work=[[TVN24]]}} Polanski was educated at the [[International School of Paris]]. She later studied acting at the [[Drama Centre London]] and the [[Central School of Speech and Drama]], graduating in 2014.{{cite news|url=http://www.harpersbazaar.com/culture/features/a10229/morgane-polanski-0415/ |title=Fabulous at Every Age: Morgane Polanski, 20s |work=[[Harper's Bazaar]] |date=12 March 2015 |accessdate=7 June 2016 |first=Charlotte |last=Cowles}} == Career == Polanski made her acting debut in her father's [[2002 in film|2002 film]] ''[[The Pianist (2002 film)|The Pianist]]'', which was nominated for [[Academy Award for Best Picture]]. She appeared in two more of his films, ''[[Oliver Twist (2005 film)|Oliver Twist]]'' (2005) and ''[[The Ghost Writer (2010 film)|The Ghost Writer]]'' (2010), in which she had her first speaking role. In 2015, Polanski appeared in the British [[independent film]] ''[[Unhallowed Ground]]'' and began portraying [[Gisela of France|Princess Gisla]] in the [[History Channel]] series ''[[Vikings (2013 TV series)|Vikings]]''. == Filmography == {| class="wikitable sortable" ! '''Paul Shrubb''' (born 1 August 1955) is an English retired professional [[association football|footballer]], [[Coach (association football)|coach]] and [[Scout (association football)|scout]] who made 350 appearances as a player in the [[The Football League|Football League]], most notably for [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] and [[Aldershot F.C.|Aldershot]].<ref name="Timeless">{{Cite book |title=Timeless Bees: Brentford F.C. Who's Who 1920–2006 |last=Haynes |first=Graham |last2=Coumbe |first2=Frank |publisher=Yore Publications |year=2006 |isbn=978-0955294914 |location=Harefield |pages=144–145}}</ref> He later returned to Aldershot as [[Assistant coach|assistant manager]] and coached at a number of [[Non-League football|non-league]] clubs.
== Playing career ==
=== Fulham === Shrubb began his career in the [[Fulham F.C. Academy|youth system]] at [[Football League Division Two|Division Two]] side [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], signing his first professional contract in 1972.<ref name="theshots">{{Cite web |url=http://archive.theshots.co.uk/news/Aldershot46556.ink |title=Guest of the Day Against Rochdale – Paul Shrubb – Aldershot Town Football Club |publisher=archive.theshots.co.uk |accessdate=4 September 2014}}</ref> He made his debut during the [[1972–73 Football League|1972–73]] season, but that would be his only appearance before his departure in 1975.<ref name="caretakers" />
=== Hellenic === Shrubb moved to [[Football in South Africa|South Africa]] to sign for [[National Football League (South Africa)|National Football League]] side [[Hellenic F.C.|Hellenic]] in 1975.<ref name="Timeless" /> The high point of his time with the club was reaching the final of the 1976 [[NFL Cup (association football)|NFL Cup]], which was lost to [[Cape Town City F.C. (NFL)|Cape Town City]].
=== Brentford === Shrubb returned to [[Football in England|England]] and joined [[Football League Division Four|Division Four]] side [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] in March 1977.<ref name="Timeless" /> With a small squad of players, Shrubb blossomed as a [[utility player]] in [[Defender (association football)|defence]] and [[Midfielder (association football)|midfield]] and contributed to the Bees' promotion to [[Football League Division Three|Division Three]] in the [[1977–78 Brentford F.C. season|1977–78]] season.<ref name="Timeless" /> Shrubb took over the [[Captain (association football)|captain's armband]] from [[Jackie Graham]] for a time, when Graham was out injured.<ref name="Timeless" /> Shrubb missed only a handful of games per season until the [[1981–82 Brentford F.C. season|1981–82]] campaign, when he was dropped early in the season.<ref name="White">{{Cite book |title=100 Years Of Brentford |publisher=Brentford FC |year=1989 |isbn=0951526200 |editor-last=White |editor-first=Eric |pages=394–396}}</ref> He departed the Bees in August 1982, having made 198 appearances and scored eight goals during his five years with the club.<ref name="Timeless" />
=== Aldershot === Shrubb signed for Division Four side [[Aldershot F.C.|Aldershot]] in August 1982,<ref name="bio">{{Cite web |url=http://archive.theshots.co.uk/PlayerDisplay.ink?skip=16&squadno=10980&season=93/94&seasonl=1993/1994&Playertype=p |title=Paul Shrubb: 1993/1994 Biography & Statistics – Aldershot Town Football Club |publisher=shop.theshots.co.uk |access-date=4 September 2014}}</ref> returning to the club after a failed trial at age 11.<ref name="testimonial">{{Cite web |url=http://archive.theshots.co.uk/news/Aldershot44589.ink |title=Paul Shrubb Testimonial Heads Pre Season List – Aldershot Town Football Club |publisher=shop.theshots.co.uk |access-date=4 September 2014}}</ref> He made 174 league appearances during a five-season spell, leaving after the Shots' success in the [[1987 Football League Fourth Division play-off Final|1987 Division Four playoff final]], which saw the club returned to Division Three for the first time in 30 years.<ref name="Hugman">{{cite web | accessdate=30 October 2016 | url=http://hugmansfootballers.com/player/17951 | title=Barry Hugman's Footballers – Paul Shrubb | website=hugmansfootballers.com}}</ref> He put his skills as a utility player to good use, wearing every single [[Squad number (association football)|shirt number]] (1–11) during his time with the club.<ref name="Timeless" />
=== Non-league football === Shrubb dropped into [[Non-League football]] in 1987 and had spells with [[Isthmian League]] sides [[Woking F.C.|Woking]], [[Dorking F.C.|Dorking]], [[Leatherhead F.C.|Leatherhead]], [[Cove F.C.|Cove]] and [[Wessex League]] side [[Fleet Town F.C.|Fleet Town]].<ref name="bio" />
=== Return to Aldershot === Shrubb returned to Aldershot in 1992, signing for [[Isthmian League Division Three]] [[Phoenix club (association football)|phoenix club]] [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]].<ref name="bio" /> The Shots won the Division Three championship during the [[1992–93 Isthmian League|1992–93]] season and secured promotion to [[Isthmian League Division One|Division One]] in the following campaign. He made 31 appearances before retiring in January 1995.<ref name="bio" /><ref name="guest">{{Cite web |url=http://archive.theshots.co.uk/news/Aldershot50124.ink |title=Paul Shrubb to be guest for Brentford replay – Aldershot Town Football Club Club News |publisher=shop.theshots.co.uk |access-date=4 September 2014}}</ref> Shrubb was awarded a [[Testimonial match|testimonial]] versus [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] on 1 August 2007, in recognition of his service to the club.<ref name="testimonial" />
== Management and coaching career == Between 1987 and 1992, Shrubb held [[Coach (association football)|player-coach]] roles with Woking, Dorking, Leatherhead, Fleet Town and Cove.<ref name="bio" /> When he returned to Aldershot in 1992, he became player-assistant manager of the club and was [[caretaker manager]] for one match in 1995, after the departure of [[Steve Wignall]].<ref name="caretakers">{{Cite web |url=http://archive.theshots.co.uk/RecordsManagersCaretakers.ink |title=Aldershot Town Football Club: Club Records – Managers – Caretakers History |publisher=shop.theshots.co.uk |access-date=4 September 2014}}</ref> He was offered the job on a permanent basis but turned it down, citing work commitments.<ref name="independent">{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/non-league-football-chapple-in-the-shots-frame-1568911.html|title=Non League Football: Chapple in the Shots' frame – Sport – The Independent|publisher=independent.co.uk|accessdate=4 September 2014}}</ref> After his retirement from playing, Shrubb served as [[Steve Wigley]]'s assistant, before departing the [[Recreation Ground (Aldershot)|Recreation Ground]] for the final time in 1997.<ref name="guest" /> He later served [[Hampton F.C.|Hampton]] and [[Kingstonian F.C.|Kingstonian]] as a coach, resigning from the latter club in April 2001, in protest over the sacking of fellow coach Ian McDonald.<ref name="kingstonian">{{cite web|url=http://www.kingstonian.net/news.jsp?2001/04|title=kingstonian.net | Latest News|publisher=kingstonian.net|accessdate=4 September 2014}}</ref>
== Scouting career == Shrubb served as a scout at Charlton Athletic, [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] and [[AFC Wimbledon]].<ref name="guest" /><ref name="theshots2">{{Cite web |url=http://archive.theshots.co.uk/news/Aldershot61664.ink |title=Aldershot Town Football Club: All About: AFC Wimbledon Club News |publisher=shop.theshots.co.uk |access-date=4 September 2014}}</ref> While with Plymouth, he worked alongside former Aldershot teammate [[Andy King (footballer, born 1956)|Andy King]].<ref name="theshots3">{{Cite web |url=http://archive.theshots.co.uk/news/Aldershot47269.ink |title=Ex-Player News – Aldershot Town Football Club |publisher=shop.theshots.co.uk |access-date=4 September 2014}}</ref>
== Personal life == Shrubb lives in [[Aldershot]] and ran his own [[window cleaning]] business.<ref name="testimonial" /><ref name="pth">{{Cite web |url=http://www.pth.org.uk/patients-families-friends/life-stories/pauls-story/ |title=Phyllis Tuckwell HospicePaul's life with MND – Phyllis Tuckwell Hospice |publisher=pth.org.uk |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140904182926/http://www.pth.org.uk/patients-families-friends/life-stories/pauls-story/ |archivedate=4 September 2014 |accessdate=4 September 2014}}</ref> He was diagnosed with [[Motor Neurone Disease Association|motor neurone disease]] in January 2006 and was given two years to live by doctors.<ref name="pth" /><ref name="theshots4">{{cite web|url=http://www.theshots.co.uk/shots-chairman-takes-public-ice-bucket-challenge-for-local-hospice/|title=Shots Chairman Takes Public Ice Bucket Challenge For Local Hospice | Aldershot Town FC|publisher=theshots.co.uk|accessdate=4 September 2014}}</ref> The condition forced Shrubb to give up full-time work in 2009.<ref name="pth" />
== Honours ==
=== As a player ===
== Honours == '''[[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]]''' * [[Football League Fourth Division]] fourth-place promotion: [[1977–78 Brentford F.C. season|1977–78]]<ref name="White" /> '''[[Aldershot F.C.|Aldershot]]/[[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]]''' * [[Football League Division Four|Football League Division Four playoffs]]: [[1987 Football League Fourth Division play-off Final|1986–87]] * [[Isthmian League Division Three]]: 1992–93 '''[[Dorking F.C.|Dorking]]''' * [[Surrey Senior Cup]]: 1989–90

{{Infobox musical artist |name = Pericoma Okoye |image = |background = solo_singer |birth_name = Pericoma Mesuo Okoye |alias = "Arusi Makaja 1 of [[Arondizuogu]]",
"Arusi Ndizuogu", "Lion of Africa", "Okala-mmuo, Okala-mmadu", "Oje-na mmuo", "Oke-arusi izuogu na iheme" |birth_date = 1935{{cite web|title=Izu ka mma na Nne ji by Pericoma Okoye|url=http://www.godsjukebox.com/Rest_In_Peace/pericoma-okoye-izu-ka-mma-na-nne-ji/|website=godsjukebox.com|publisher=Gods Jukebox}} |death_date = February 16, 2017 |origin = [[Arondizuogu]], [[Imo State|Imo]], [[Nigeria]] |genre = [[Traditional music]] |occupation = Singer, songwriter and prime minister }} '''Chief Pericoma Mezuo Okoye''' was a Nigerian [[singer]], [[songwriter]] and [[tradition]]ist.{{Cite web|url=http://www.weeklypostng.org/2017/02/breaking-pericoma-is-dead-photos.html?m=1|title=BREAKING!!! Legendary Musician, Pericomo Okoye aka 'Arusi Makaja 1 Of Igboland' Is Dead (Photos)|website=www.weeklypostng.org|access-date=2017-02-17}} His first name 'Pericoma' could alternatively be spelled as 'Pericomo' 'Perry-Coma' and 'Perry-Koma'. He was predominantly known throughout the [[Igboland]] for his style of music and strong belief and practice of the traditional religion of the [[Igbo people]], named [[Obeah]].{{Cite journal|last=Heffernan|first=Andrew|title=Obeah, Christianity, and Jamaica|url=https://www.academia.edu/10845660/Obeah_Christianity_and_Jamaica|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.memidex.com/obeah+religious-cult|title=obeah (religious cult) - Memidex dictionary/thesaurus|website=www.memidex.com|access-date=2017-02-24}} ==Early life == Okoye was born in Nigeria, specifically in [[Imo State]], an eastern state occupied by the Igbo people of Nigeria. He was born in a community named [[Arondizuogu]], a community that occupies three local government areas: [[Ideato North]], [[Okigwe]], and [[Onuimo]]. ==Prime minister == Okoye was prime minister of the Arondizogu community in Imo state until his death in 2017.{{Cite news|url=http://elombah.com/index.php/reports/14386-breaking-news-pericoma-okoye-is-dead|title=Popular Igbo Musician Pericoma Okoye Is Dead [Update]|last=Elombah|first=Tim|newspaper=E-max|access-date=2017-02-17|language=en-gb}} ==Music style== His music style could be best described as "oral rendition of the culture, proverbs, as well as the tradition of the Igbo people".{{Cite web|url=http://authorityngr.com/2017/02/-Igbo-traditional-high-life-music-exponent-Pericoma-Okoye-passes-on/|title=Igbo traditional high life music exponent, Pericoma Okoye, passes on|website=authorityngr.com|language=en|access-date=2017-02-17}} ==Acting career == He featured in a movie titled ''Lion Of Africa'' alongside Nollywood star, [[Pete Edochie]]. The movie, which was in two parts, was a biography of his early life.{{Citation|last=Aku-King NollyTV|title=LION OF AFRICA 1 = African Best Movie|date=2015-12-02|url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=49kftLI1Q7c|accessdate=2017-02-17}} ==Personal life== Okoye was a firm believer and practitioner of the traditional religion of the Igbo people, Obeah.{{Cite web|url=https://prezi.com/m/l1d_8jw6suli/obeah/|title=Obeah|website=prezi.com|language=en|access-date=2017-02-24}}{{Cite web|url=http://ancestralvoices.tumblr.com/post/125752669232/kemetic-dreams-obeah-sometimes-spelled-obi|title=kemetic-dreams: Obeah (sometimes spelled Obi,... {{!}} Ancestral Voices: Esoteric African knowledge|website=Ancestral Voices: Esoteric African knowledge|language=en|access-date=2017-02-24}} ==Traditional religion== Pericoma Okoye whilst alive was as much a famous sorcerer or 'medicine man' as he was a musician as described by Nigerian News, NAIJ.{{Cite news|url=https://www.naij.com/1088720-ichie-mezuo-pericomo-okoye-arusi-makaja-1-aka-pericoma-allegedly-dies.html|title=Igboland griefs as top traditionalist dies (photos)|last=Odunayo|first=Adams|newspaper=Naij.com – Nigeria news.|access-date=2017-02-17|language=en-US}} His title 'Arusi Makaja' may also portray this, as 'Arusi' when translated to English language means 'deity' or 'oracle'. During the Ikeji festival{{Citation|last=Onyekaba Ugo|title=Pericoma Okoye (IKEJI FESTIVAL '77) 1|date=2013-09-16|url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Sp8ZDKGL13E|accessdate=2017-05-21}} he performed several feats which defied several rules of physics. A good percentage of the people from [[Arondizuogu]], his community, believed he was a little god. Several displays of "supernatural powers" or "sorcery" as it was often tagged, and back-to-back victories in contests, earned him the alias "Lion of Africa".{{Cite web|url=http://9jaflaver.com/igbo-musician-magician-lion-of-africa-actor-pericoma-is-dead/|title=Igbo Musician, Magician & "Lion Of Africa" Actor, Pericoma Is Dead {{!}} 9jaflaver|website=9jaflaver.com|access-date=2017-02-17}} ==Significance == Okoye was a prominent individual in Nigeria as a traditional prime minister in Imo state. He was instrumental and took notable roles in the development of the Ikeji festival{{Cite web|url=http://logbaby.com/encyclopedia/ikeji-festival-of-ar_12624.html|title=IKEJI FESTIVAL OF ARONDIZUOGU Logbaby|website=logbaby.com|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-02-17}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.nico.gov.ng/index.php/cultural-events/37-cultural-events/475-ikeji-festival-in-arondizogu|title=Ikeji Festival In Arondizogu|last=Webmaster|website=www.nico.gov.ng|language=en-gb|access-date=2017-02-17}} held in his community. This festival which is held every April serves as a source of foreign income for Nigeria, as it attracts tourists from around the world.{{Cite news|url=http://www.vanguardngr.com/2014/03/ikeji-festival-boost-nigerias-culture/|title=Ikeji festival: A boost to Nigeria’s culture – Vanguard News|date=2014-03-14|newspaper=Vanguard News|access-date=2017-02-17|language=en-US}} ==Selected discography == *''High Tension'' *''Ikeji Izuogu'' *''Obodo Aghoka'' *''Igatakwuteya Aja'' *''Izu Ka Mma Na Nne Ji''{{Cite web|url=http://www.meetnigerians.net/members/videos.php?cmd=w&t=pericoma+okoye-+izu+ka+mma+na+nne+ji&v=IjMdE0fu258&ch=UCuooZI9u0ZSGB58LMrT_T0w|title=pericoma okoye- izu ka mma na nne ji|website=www.meetnigerians.net|language=en|access-date=2017-07-12}} ==Death == On 16 February 2017, he was reported dead.{{Cite web|url=http://www.tori.ng/news/53748/a-legend-goes-home-ichie-pericomo-okoye-arusi-maka.html|title=A Legend Goes Home: Ichie Pericomo Okoye, Arusi Makaja 1, a.k.a Pericoma, Allegedly Passes On|last=Tori.ng|website=Tori News|access-date=2017-02-17}} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Okoye, Pericoma}} [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:2017 deaths]] [[Category:Nigerian people]] [[Category:Nigerian male singers]]

{{Infobox royalty | name = Princess Rym | image = PrincessRymJI1.jpg | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1969}} | birth_place = [[Cairo]], Egypt | caption = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Prince Ali bin Hussein]]|2004|}} | house = [[Hashemite]] (by marriage) | issue = Princess Jalila
Prince Abdullah | father = [[Lakhdar Brahimi]] }} {{Jordanian Royal Family}} '''Princess Rym al-Ali''' (born 1969) is the [[Algeria]]n{{cite web|url= http://www.hellomagazine.com/royalty/2004/04/28/princeali/ |title= Jordan's Prince Ali to wed CNN reporter |publisher= hellomagazine.com |accessdate= 23 October 2014}} wife of [[Prince Ali bin Hussein]] of [[Jordan]], whom she married on September 7, 2004. She is the daughter of [[Lakhdar Brahimi]], former Algerian Minister for Foreign Affairs and senior UN official.{{cite web| title=The Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan| work=| url=http://www.gilani.com.pk/kings/kingsjordan.htm| accessdate=2008-11-02| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081207080422/http://www.gilani.com.pk/kings/kingsjordan.htm| archivedate=2008-12-07| df=}} She was raised in Great Britain and [[Algeria]]. She was educated in [[France]] and the United States. She and [[Prince Ali bin Al Hussein|Prince Ali]] live in [[Amman]] with their two children [[Princess Jalila bint Ali]] and [[Prince Abdullah bin Ali]].[http://www.royalark.net/Jordan/jordan3.htm Royal Ark] == Education == * BA in geography and an MA in English literature at the [[Sorbonne University]] in [[Paris]] - graduated with honors in 1990{{citation needed|date=November 2016}} * MPhil in political science at the [[Institut d'Études Politiques de Paris]] in Paris in 1991{{cite web | title=Board of Commissioners | work=Royal Film Commission (Jordan) | url=http://www.film.jo/pages.php?menu_id=12 | accessdate=2008-11-28 }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} * Master's degree at Graduate School of Journalism, concentrating on international reporting - [[Columbia University]] in 1994{{cite web| title=Her Royal High Princess Rym Al Ali| work=HRH Princess Haya Bint Al Hussein| url=http://www.princesshaya.net/bio_rym.htm| accessdate=2008-11-02| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080917220027/http://www.princesshaya.net/bio_rym.htm| archivedate=2008-09-17| df=}} == Career == Earlier in her career she worked at United Nations Bureaus of the [[BBC World Service]], the [[United Press International]], Dubai TV, [[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]] International, Radio Monte Carlo Moyen Orient and [[CNN]] (London).{{Citation needed|date=November 2016}} She has been the Executive Commissioner of the [[Royal Film Commission - Jordan]] since 2006.{{cite web | title=Mr. Shigenobu Kato, Ambassador of Japan, delivered a speech at the graduation ceremony of the animation workshop on 27 January 2008 | work=Embassy of Japan in Jordan | url=http://www.jordan.emb-japan.go.jp/eng_release/eng_speech_cul_0801_anime.htm | accessdate=2008-11-02}} She is the founder of the [[Jordan Media Institute]] (JMI), a non-profit body whose aim is to establish an Arab Center of Excellence for Journalism Education with a Masters’ programme at its core.{{cite web | title=New Projects Submitted to the IPDC | work=IPDC Bureau | url=http://portal.unesco.org/ci/en/files/26311/1206464201304_Arab_region_and_Europe_2008.pdf/04%2BArab%2Bregion%2Band%2BEurope%2B2008.pdf | accessdate=2008-11-28}} == Awards == * In April 2011 Princess Rym Ali received a prestigious award from the Columbia University School of Journalism. The Alumni Awards are presented annually for a distinguished [[journalism]] career, an outstanding journalistic achievement, or a notable contribution to journalism education. * In July 2011, was awarded the “Best International Journalist” prize at the 32nd Ischia International Journalism Awards Ceremony, one of the most prestigious journalistic awards in Italy.{{cite web|title=International Journalism Award to Princess Rym Ali|url=http://www.jmi.edu.jo/en/node/479|publisher=[[Jordan Media Institute]]|accessdate=19 May 2012|date=18 July 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110806080401/http://www.jmi.edu.jo/en/node/479|archivedate=6 August 2011|df=}} * In September 20, 2011, Princess Rym Ali was decorated with French Knight of the [[Legion of Honour]] by French Ambassador to Jordan. * In October 2012, she was awarded the Global Thinkers Forum 2012 Award for Excellence in Media for her exceptional work with the [[Jordan Media Institute]] (JMI). * In November 2013,she was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Letters by the United Kingdom’s [[Coventry University]] for her contribution to the field of journalism and media, and her role in establishing the [[Jordan Media Institute]] (JMI).{{cite web|title=Princess Rym Ali Receives Honorary Degree from Coventry University|url=http://www.jmi.edu.jo/en/details/3030/Princess-Rym-Ali-Receives-Honorary-Degree-from-Coventry-University|df=}} * In April 2018, she was decorated with The [[Order of Prince Henry]] the Navigator by The Portuguese President, [[Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa]] for her efforts in the field of culture and intercultural exchange.{{cite web|title=Portuguese President Honors HRH Princess Rym Ali|url=http://petra.gov.jo/Public_News/Nws_NewsDetails.aspx?Site_Id=1&lang=2&NewsID=347981&CatID=-1|df=}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons category|Princess Rym}} {{multiple issues| {{BLP sources|date=June 2016}} {{original research|date=June 2016}} {{undue|date=June 2016}} {{POV|date=June 2016}} }}
'''[[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]]''' was the [[president of Argentina]] between 2007 and 2015.
==Personal image== [[File:Visita a la planta Toyota en Zárate.jpg|thumb|Cristina Kirchner, dressed in black]] After her victory in the [[Argentine general election, 2011|2011 presidential elections]], she claimed that the elections were a triumph of love, implying that her voters loved her.<ref>Mendelevich, p. 33</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1397684-resultados-de-las-elecciones-primarias-2011|title= Cristina Kirchner, con el 50 por ciento de los votos, quedó a las puertas de la reelección|trans-title=Cristina Kirchner, with 50% of the vote, is in the doorstep of re-election|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 15, 2011|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=August 9, 2016}}</ref> Her speeches include a large number of self-references.<ref>Mendelevich, pp. 375–376</ref>
Kirchner is famously passionate about clothes.<ref name="estilo">{{Cite news|url=http://edant.clarin.com/diario/2007/12/11/elpais/p-01001.htm|title=El estilo Cristina presidenta: vestido más sobrio y maquillaje más discreto|publisher=Clarin.com|date=11 December 2007|accessdate=15 April 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/article2702799.ece|title=Argentina's new Evita Peron tangoes her way to power|work=The Times|location=UK|date=21 October 2007|accessdate=15 April 2011}}</ref> She wears a mixture of textures, colors, and prints, and always wears makeup and high heels.<ref name="estilo" /> She dressed in black for the 3 years following the [[death and state funeral of Néstor Kirchner|death of her husband]], [[Néstor Kirchner]]. The acceptance of this [[widow]] image was higher among Argentine women.<ref>Mendelevich, pp. 220–221</ref> According to Kirchner's detractors her condition of widowhood was accompanied by a campaign of idealization of her late husband, who was allegedly treated as a religious figure.<ref>Mendelevich, pp. 132–134</ref> Kirchner ceased wearing black clothes on November 20, 2013, after three years and a month.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://tn.com.ar/politica/definitivo-el-paso-a-paso-de-como-cristina-abandono-el-luto_423689|title= Definitivo: el paso a paso de cómo Cristina abandonó el luto|trans-title=Definitive: the step by step of how Cristina left her mourning|language= Spanish|author= |date= November 26, 2013|publisher= Todo Noticias|accessdate=October 31, 2014}}</ref>
===Use of social media=== Kirchner is one of the few Argentines with a [[Twitter]] account with over a million followers, along with [[Gustavo Cerati]], [[Emanuel Ginóbili]], [[Sergio Agüero]], [[Luisana Lopilato]], [[Zaira Nara]], [[Jorge Rial]], and [[Paula Chaves]].<ref name="M357">Mendelevich, p. 357</ref> Her messages are written in an informal tone, and may criticise or mock fellow politicians or her opponents, or may be about her private life.<ref name="M357" /> Her messages are usually written in [[Grammatical person|second person singular]], which in Spanish is mainly used when talking to a close friend. The account is however rarely used to chat with anyone and it follows only 50 others, mainly members of her cabinet, world leaders, and government institutions.<ref>Mendelevich, p. 358</ref>
==Political image== Cristina Kirchner is a highly divisive political figure in Argentina.<ref name="divided">{{cite web |url= https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/argentine-president-set-to-leave-office-and-a-divided-nation/article22886073/|title= Argentine President set to leave office and a divided nation|author= Stephanie Nolen|date= February 9, 2015|publisher= The Globe and Mail|accessdate=July 28, 2015}}</ref> The Kirchnerite administration used its aligned media and the communication outlets of the state for advocacy of the figures of both Cristina Kirchner and the previous president, her husband Néstor Kirchner.<ref name="Mendelevich311"/> This advocacy, which describes the Kirchners as leaders of a revolution, is usually called the "Relato K" ({{lang-es|K narrative}}).<ref name="Mendelevich311">Mendelevich, p. 311</ref><ref>Romero, p. 115</ref> Political life is described as a [[conflict between good and evil]], in a manner similar to [[religious faith]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/opinion/Kirchnerismo-progresismo-conservador_0_757124369.html|title= Kirchnerismo, un progresismo conservador|trans-title=Kirchnerism, a conservative progresism|language= Spanish|author= Lucio Lapeña|date= August 17, 2012|work= Clarín|accessdate=October 29, 2014}}</ref> From this perspective, the "good" side consists of the government and the Argentine people as a whole,<ref name="katz">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1491274-el-progresismo-reaccionario|title= El progresismo reaccionario|trans-title=The conservative progresism|language= Spanish|author= Alejandro Katz|date= July 18, 2012|work= La Nación|accessdate=October 29, 2014}}</ref> while the "evil" side consists of the non-aligned media{{Clarify|date=June 2016}} (mainly the [[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|''Clarín'' newspaper]]), the rural industries, the [[financial services]], the [[vulture funds]],<ref name="M210">Mendelevich, pp. 210–211</ref> and the [[imperialism]] and local Argentines aligned with it.<ref name="katz" /> Again according to her detractors all the problems in the Kirchner administration are blamed on those sectors; Kirchnerism never engages in self-criticism.<ref name="M210" />{{Better source|date=June 2016}} Specific people or organizations may be placed on either the "good" or "evil" side according to the political needs of the time, and the pro-Kirchner network may shift the support or criticism accordingly.<ref name="katz" /> Her speeches also resort to [[appeal to emotion]].<ref name="divided" />
Cristina Kirchner also uses comparisons with historical events to support her policies. It has been stated by the historian [[Luis Alberto Romero]] that those comparisons are usually inaccurate and misleading, but most professional historians prefer to ignore them, and focus on her actual policies instead.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1823976-una-curiosa-interpretacion-del-pasado|title= Una curiosa interpretación del pasado|trans-title=A strange view of the past|language= Spanish|author= [[Luis Alberto Romero]]|date= September 1, 2015|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=September 1, 2015}}</ref>
The media that promotes the "''Relato K''" is divided into three main groups. First is state-owned media, which is used solely by the governing party. Second is new, private media with very low audiences, which stays in business only due to the financial support of the government.<ref name="M296" /> Third is other private media that predated the Kirchnerite administrations and that eventually got aligned with it, also receiving financial support for doing so.<ref name="M296">Mendelevich, p. 296</ref> Soccer broadcasting was nationalized in the program ''[[Fútbol para todos]]'', and then filled with pro-government advertisements.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702303382004579131063662086126|title= Kirchner Moves Against Argentina's Free Press|author= Mary Anastasia O'Grady|date= October 13, 2013|publisher= The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=September 1, 2014}}</ref> There are also a number of people hired to support the Kirchners at [[internet forum]]s and other [[virtual communities]].<ref>Mendelevich, pp. 52–54</ref>
In 2008, Kirchner was ranked by ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine as thirteenth on its list of the [[Forbes Magazine's List of The World's 100 Most Powerful Women|100 most powerful women in the world]], being the second female head of government in the list below [[Angela Merkel]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1044015|title=Cristina figura entre las más poderosas|publisher=Lanacion.com.ar|accessdate=6 November 2010}}</ref> In 2009 she rose to eleventh,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1164485|title=Cristina, entre las 100 mujeres más poderosas|publisher=Lanacion.com.ar|date=18 August 2009|accessdate=6 November 2010}}</ref> but in 2010 fell to sixty-eighth.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1312516|title=La Presidenta quedó en el puesto 68 del listado de mujeres más poderosas del mundo|publisher=Lanacion.com.ar|accessdate=6 November 2010}}</ref> As of 2014, she is listed as the nineteenth most influential woman in the world.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/power-women/list/#tab:overall|title=The World's 100 Most Powerful Women|last=Howard|first=Caroline|work=[[Forbes]]|year=2015}}</ref> In 2010, she was ranked by ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' as fourth on its list of Top 10 Female Leaders of the World.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/completelist/0,29569,2005455,00.html|title=Top 10 Female Leaders|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|accessdate=6 November 2010}}</ref>
===Approval ratings and popular support=== Cristina Fernández was first elected [[President of Argentina]] following [[Argentine general election, 2007|2007 elections]], in which she scored 45.3% of the vote (8,651,066), nearly twice as much as her main opponent, [[Elisa Carrió]], of the center-right [[Civic Coalition ARI|ARI]] party, who garnered 23.0%. Throughout her first term, Cristina Fernández' [[approval ratings]] have varied significantly; when she took office, her popularity reportedly stood at 57.8%. By 2009, however, her approval had plummeted to a mere 23%,<ref>http://elpais.com/diario/2008/04/09/internacional/1207692007_850215.html</ref> following the [[2008 Argentine government conflict with the agricultural sector]]. Despite declining approval ratings in the middle of her first term, Cristina Férnandez went on to secure an outright victory in the [[Argentine general election, 2011]], securing 54.1% of the vote, and a record 11.9 million votes, soundly defeating the [[Socialist Party (Argentina)|Socialist]] [[Hermes Binner]], who obtained 16.8% of the vote.<ref>http://www.electionresources.org/ar/president.php?election=2011</ref>
By 2012, her approval ratings once again suffered a dip, this time to around 40%, while anti-government protests attracted 250,000–500,000 demonstrators in [[Buenos Aires]] in November that year.<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/nov/09/argentiana-protests-rally-fernandez-kirchner</ref> In the [[Argentine legislative election, 2013|2013 mid-term elections]], the president's [[Justicialist Party]] suffered setbacks, dropping from 54% to 33% of the vote.<ref>https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-24690531</ref> However, partly due to the [[staggered elections|staggered]] [[Elections in Argentina|electoral system in Argentina]], the government retained its majority in both [[Argentine National Congress|houses of congress]]. As she was barred from running for a third term in 2015 due to [[term limits]], Cristina Férnandez' handpicked successor, [[Daniel Scioli]], contested the [[Argentine general election, 2015]] on the Justicialist ticket.<ref>https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/argentina-presidential-elections-2015-voters-polls</ref> However, after 12 years of Kirchnerite rule, Scioli was narrowly defeated by the center-right [[Cambiemos]] candidate, [[Mauricio Macri]].<ref>https://next.ft.com/content/80f67520-9170-11e5-bd82-c1fb87bef7af</ref> By the end of her eight-year reign, Cristina Férnandez enjoyed approval ratings above 50%.<ref>https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-34623236</ref> According to some polls, however, her disapproval was only marginally lower than that, reinforcing Kirchner's image as a divisive leader.<ref>http://www.perfil.com/politica/Una-encuesta-revela-quienes-son-los-politicos-con-mejor-imagen--20160119-0042.html</ref> As of July 2016, no longer being president, she became the politician with the highest disapproval ratings, alongside other members of her former cabinet. This was caused by the advances in the investigations of a big number of cases of political corruption that took place during her presidency, and her lack of activity.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1916249-elecciones-2017-imagen-politicos-bajo-la-lupa-de-los-encuestadores|title= Elecciones 2017: la imagen de Cristina, Macri y Carrió, bajo la lupa de los encuestadores|trans-title=Elections 2017: the image of Cristina, Macri and Carrió, under the lens of surveys|language= Spanish|author= Matías Moreno|date= July 7, 2016|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=July 7, 2016}}</ref>
==In popular culture== [[File:Cristina Fernandez, Gran Cuñado.jpg|thumb|Comedian [[Martín Bossi]] parodies the then Argentine president [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]], next to TV host [[Marcelo Tinelli]].]] [[Martín Bossi]] parodied Cristina Kirchner in 2009 at ''[[Gran Cuñado]]'' ({{lang-es|Big Brother-in-law}}), which featured parodies of Argentine politicians. The show itself was a parody of the ''[[Gran Hermano Argentina|Big Brother]]'' reality show <ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.perfil.com/espectaculos/Martin-Bossi-el-hombre-que-hara-de-la-Presidenta-en-Gran-Cunado-es-el-nuevo-enemigo-de-los-Kirchner-20090322-0007.html|title= Martín Bossi, el hombre que hará de la Presidenta en "Gran Cuñado", es el nuevo enemigo de los Kirchner|trans-title=Martín Bossi, the man who will play the president at "Gran Cuñado"|language= Spanish|author= |date= March 22, 2009|publisher= Perfil|accessdate=October 31, 2014}}</ref> Bossi's masks were prepared by Andrés Parrilla and the scripts written by [[Nik]] and Pablo Semmartín. Bossio commented that he watched videos of Kirchner to prepare and that the main trait of the parody character, was that the character's face and words would suggest completely different things.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://edant.clarin.com/diario/2009/05/23/um/m-01924277.htm|title= Martín Bossi y Freddy Villarreal, el doble comando del humor político|trans-title=Martín Bossi and Freddy Villareal, the double command of political humor|language= Spanish|author= Fernanda Longo|date= May 22, 2009|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=October 31, 2014}}</ref>
Minister [[Anibal Fernandez]] criticized this parody, arguing that, "In some ways I think there were excesses, it should be regulated because it is the President, and other things, were very successful: we must be fair to those things".<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1127534-gran-cunado-sigue-desvelando-a-los-politicos|title= "Gran Cuñado" sigue desvelando a los políticos|trans-title=Gran Cuñado stills concerns the politicians|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 13, 2009|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 31, 2014}}</ref> Shortly after, he recanted on the use of the word "regulate", but insisted that the presidential parody should be removed from the program.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1128516-anibal-fernandez-sugirio-sacar-a-la-presidenta-del-programa-de-tinelli|title= Aníbal Fernández sugirió sacar a la Presidenta del programa de Tinelli|trans-title=Aníbal Fernández suggested to remove the president from Tinelli's program|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 15, 2009|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 31, 2014}}</ref>
The program of investigative journalism ''[[Periodismo para todos]]'' opens with a [[stand-up comedy]] routine in which [[Jorge Lanata]] comments on the political events of the week. Actress [[Fátima Florez]] parodies Cristina Kirchner in these portions of the program. Florez began preparing her character in 2007, focusing on Kirchner's speaking style and hand movements. Florez uses a mask that takes three hours to apply. The parody, and Florez, became famous in Argentina.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.parati.com.ar/lo-nuevo/personajes/fatima-florez/13097.html|title= Fátima Florez|trans-title=|language= Spanish|author= Agustina Andraia|date= June 2012|publisher= Para Tí|accessdate=November 4, 2014}}</ref> She later performed in theaters using the same character, focusing more on general humor than political satire.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1496005-fatima-florez-si-mi-imitacion-no-le-hubiese-gustado-a-cristina-ya-me-lo-hubieran-hecho-saber|title= Fátima Florez: "Si a Cristina no le gustase la imitación, me lo habrían hecho saber"|trans-title=Fátima Florez: "If Cristina did not like my imitation, they would have already told me"|language= Spanish|author= Daniela Pérez González|date= August 7, 2012|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 4, 2014}}</ref>
The Venezuelan animated series ''[[Isla Presidencial]]'' included a parody of Cristina Kirchner as well as other Latin American presidents.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/mundo/Maduro-pajarito-llegan-Isla-Presidencial_0_977902438.html|title= Maduro y su pajarito llegan a "La Isla Presidencial"|trans-title=Maduro and his little bird appear in "Isla Presidencial"|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 20, 2013|publisher= Clarín|accessdate=November 4, 2014}}</ref>

{{Short description|Belgian artist, creator of Musti}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Ray Goossens | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1924|8|14}} | birth_place = [[Merksem]], [[Belgium]] | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|1998|12|10|1924|8|14}} | death_place = [[Deurne, Belgium]] | nationality = [[Belgium]] | other_names = | known_for = | years_active = 1939-1991 | occupation = Artist, animator, film director, and writer }} '''Ray Goossens''' (14 August 1924 – 10 December 1998) was a [[Belgian people|Belgian]] artist, animator, writer, and director best known for creating the cartoon character [[Musti (character)|Musti]].
==Biography== Ray Goossens was born in [[Merksem]], Belgium in 1924. Interested in animation from before [[World War II]], he founded the [[AFIM (animation studio)|AFIM]] animation studios with Henri Winkeler and Edmond Roex<ref name="AFIM">{{cite web | url = https://www.lambiek.net/artists/g/goossens_ray.htm | accessdate = 2015-10-11 | title = Ray Goossens | publisher = Lambiek Comiclopedia}}</ref> in 1940.{{citation needed|date=October 2015}} They had 15 employees, including later famous comics artists like [[Bob de Moor]] and [[Jef Nys]]. They created a number of short animated movies, of which ''[[Smidje Smee]]'' was the most successful.
After the war, Goossens started working as a comics creator with ''[[Kleine Zondagsvriend]]'', a weekly youth magazine. He created a number of series, some based on existing stories like ''[[Tijl Uilenspiegel]]'' and ''[[Reynard cycle|Reinaert de Vos]]'', some new like ''Tsjoem'' (a parrot) and ''Snops en de bende''. He also worked as an illustrator for different newspapers and magazines, including ''[[Gazet van Antwerpen]]''.
He worked as an animator mainly for client's publicity purposes, and in 1957 became [[artistic director]] of [[Belvision]], the new animation studios of [[Le Lombard]], one of the major Belgian comics publishers. At first, they created series based on existing comics series like ''[[Oumpah-pah]]'', ''[[Hergé's Adventures of Tintin]]'' or ''[[Raymond Macherot#Chlorophylle|Chlorophylle]]''. They also made the full-length movie ''[[Pinocchio in Outer Space]]''.
From 1956 to 1969 he worked as an independent animator and director. In 1967 he directed ''[[Asterix the Gaul (film)|Asterix the Gaul]]'', the first feature film based on this comic, and in 1968 he joined [[Dupuis]], where he created with the animation studios a number of children's series like ''[[Tip en Tap]]'', ''[[De Pili's]]'' and ''[[Musti (TV series)|Musti]]'', which was based on a character he had already created in 1945. He also directed a series based on the adventures of ''[[Boule et Bill]]''.
From 1976 onwards, Ray Goossens taught animation at the [[R.I.T.C.S]] in Brussels. His final success as a director followed in 1980, with ''[[Plons de gekke kikker]]''.
Ray Goossens died in 1998 in [[Deurne, Belgium|Deurne]].

{{Infobox person | name = Robert K. Heuberger | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1922|01|12|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Olten]], [[Switzerland]] | occupation = Swiss real estate entrepreneur, [[Patron]] and Author | spouse = Ruth Heuberger<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.clubofrome.org/member/robert-k-heuberger/ |title=Heuberger, Robert K. |publisher=The Club of Rome |access-date=16 November 2017}}</ref> }}
'''Robert K. Heuberger''' (12 January 1922<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.winterthur-glossar.ch/app/default/pub/fw.action/wine.article?ce_id=345&ce_name=person |title=Robert K. Heuberger, Immobilen-Unternehmer, *1922 |publisher=Winterthur Glossar |access-date=16 November 2017}}</ref> in [[Olten]]) is a Swiss real estate entrepreneur, patron and author under the pseudonym '''Victor Vermont'''.
== Life and career == Heuberger grew up in poor circumstances. He completed his training at the [[Credit Suisse|Swiss Volksbank]] in [[Aarburg]] in the 1930s. As a bank and insurance buyer, he later worked for the Volksbank as an accountant, credit manager and securities specialist, then as an agency manager for the [[Bâloise]] insurance company.
Together with his wife Ruth, born Mötteli (* 1924, † 2016),<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.todesanzeigenportal.ch/todesanzeige/Ruth/Lina/Heuberger/M%C3%B6tteli/ |title=Trauerfall Heuberger Ruth Lina |date=9 October 2016 |publisher=Todesanzeigenportal Schweiz |access-date=16 November 2017}}</ref> Heuberger founded Siska Heuberger Holding AG in 1954, with which he implemented a series of major building projects, especially in eastern Switzerland, with the construction of about 1000 apartments in [[Winterthur]]. According to the economic magazine's [[BILANZ]], he had assets of approximately CHF300 to 500 million in 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nzz.ch/zuerich/aus-dem-leben-eines-tycoons-1.18223917 |title=Aus dem Leben eines Tycoons |author=Marc Tribelhorn |date=18 January 2014 |publisher=Neue Zürcher Zeitung |access-date=16 November 2017}}</ref>
He is the father of the media entrepreneur, Günther Heuberger, and father of Rainer Heuberger, old [[Cantonal Council of Zürich]] ([[Swiss People's Party|SVP]]) and owner of Siska Verwaltungs AG<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.jungunternehmer-preis.ch/2013/dokumente/Berichterstattung_NZZaS_130623.pdf |title=Überschätze dich selbst! |author=Marco Metzler |date=23 June 2013 |publisher=Neue Zürcher Zeitung |access-date=16 November 2017}}</ref>
== Engagement == Heuberger's public commitment includes funding for the establishment of the [[Club of Rome]] in Winterthur, setting up the non-profit «Robert and Ruth Heuberger Foundation», as well as founding an innovation prize for young entrepreneurs. In 2007, the City of Winterthur awarded him the prize of the "Winterthur Lion". In 2013, Heuberger drew attention to the initiative to abolish conscription by means of double-page advertisements. The referendum was clearly rejected.
== Honors == The asteroid [[82232 Heuberger]], discovered by [[Markus Griesser (astronomer)|Markus Griesser]] at the Swiss [[Eschenberg Observatory]] in 2001, has been named in honor of Robert and Ruth Heuberger's commitment to social and cultural institutions.<ref name="MPC-object" /> The official naming citation was published by the [[Minor Planet Center]] on 13 July 2004 ({{small|[[Minor Planet Circulars|M.P.C.]] 52327}}).<ref name="MPC-Circulars-Archive" />
